column4: Can anyone help me out a bit with automatically mounting Windows partitions to be accessable through a non-root user?  My fstab currently reads '/dev/hda5 /mnt/stuff ntfs rw,suid,dev,exec,auto,user,async 00'
Assumming you are aware thar there is no write support for ntfs in ubuntu, add a umask=000 to your mount-options
Was just going with an altered version of 'defaults' and forgot to take out the 'rw'.  Thanks.
